SUMMARY: Here’s a look at what markets are expecting and planning for, and how a default might happen.

TITLE: Consumer Spending Rose More Than Expected in April
SUMMARY: New data on spending and income suggest that the economy remains robust despite the Federal Reserve’s interest rate increases.

TITLE: Restaurant Chain Franchises Face Scrutiny From the FTC
SUMMARY: Troubles at the restaurant chain Burgerim highlight concerns about whether franchisees need more protection in their contracts with franchisers.

TITLE: White House and GOP Close In on Debt Ceiling Deal
SUMMARY: The details were not finalized, but negotiators were discussing a compromise that would allow Republicans to point to spending reductions and Democrats to say they had prevented large cuts.

TITLE: Biden Officials Announce Indo-Pacific Trade Deal, Clashing With Industry Groups
SUMMARY: The United States announced a deal to coordinate supply chains with allies, but prominent business groups said the deal fell short on reducing tariffs and other trade barriers.

TITLE: Yellen’s Debt Limit Warnings Went Unheeded, Leaving Her to Face Fallout
SUMMARY: The Treasury secretary, who considered ways to contain the fallout of a default when she was a Fed official in 2011, had urged Democrats to raise the limit while they still had control of Congress.
